body:
I think that #1559 brought back an old bug that was hidden by flatten

Using --with-flatten=full should revert to 0.13/0.14 behavior and get a type composition instead of the mix composition branch + properties.

@aalexanderr could you please add the Validate() code to better locate the problem?
If it shows a similar pattern, then the problem is in model construction (model.go). If you see your properties there, then it is just a template issue... Thanks

Does it go better with the following? Looks more like a regular allOf construct:

```yaml
  ArtifactInfo:
    type: object
    allOf:
     - $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactDescription'
     - properties:
         Path:
           $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactPath'
         Status:
           $ref: '#/definitions/ArtifactStatus'
         Timestamp:
           type: string
           format: date-time
```

I'm not sure which approach is correct? Using allOf you had provided makes marshalling work but  I'd prefer to have one ArtifactInfo struct which embeds ArtifactDescription and has rest of the allOf as struct fields directly rather than through additional AllOf1 struct. Will this behaviour be supported?

I know I know. I agree that something is not working.
Thanks to your valuable feedback, I think I may now poinpoint it in the code. Since Validate() seems to work properly, it is most likely just a simple template issue, around (here](https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/ab9a87e18ec6b80569e0429af8bac2dc6277fe34/generator/templates/tupleserializer.gotmpl#L257).

But since I can't promise a fix right away, I tried to figure out some work arounds for you:
- so you have the regular allOf structure (well that's the same story as #1042)
- or the full flatten option

Thanks for the response!

full flatten alone does not resolve the issue. 

Currently I have removed explicit marshaller (as the implicit one works just fine) after code generation. When the issue will be resolved I will just update swagger and regenerate the server code.

issue.title: Missing fields in generated marshaler/unmarshaler when the object extends other objects

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

issue.body:
## Problem statement
When an object extends other objects (using `allOf`), the generated Marshaler and Unmarshaler don't handle the fields in enclosing object.

The fix to [#847](https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/847) looks good (not tested myself)

## Swagger specification
[swagger.yaml](https://github.com/yan-zhuang/swagger-allof-test/blob/master/swagger.yaml)

## Steps to reproduce
* generate server from the swagger file.
`swagger generate server`
* verify the generated `models/b.go` file.
* expecting field `F3` and `F4` are handled correctly in MarshalJSON and UnmarshalJSON methods.

## Environment
swagger version: from 71225c4a7882ae49cd57e22292a58dff382908e8 to 0.10.0 and the latest
go version: go version go1.7.1 linux/amd64 
OS:   Linux test 3.10.0-327.18.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Apr 8 05:09:53 EDT 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

issue.title: Add support for top-level properties in models with AllOf
issue.body:
* Fixes #1617

NOTE: currently still does not support additionalProperties (or additionalItems) at this level

body: Verified with 0.16.0 -thanks a lot for help!
yep, 0.16 is essentially fixing a couple bugs that we had left behind with 0.15 + the stratoscale contributed set of templates
